definition: ruthless/fierce/ferocious/determined/to harden (one's heart)/old variant of 很[hen3]
ruthless/fierce/ferocious/determined/to harden (one's heart)/old variant of 很[hen3]

sentences.english: Often rather and slowly hike to her mercilessly rumple contiguous she into bosom in.
sentences.chinese: 常宁慢慢走到她的身边，狠狠的将她揉进怀中。

sentences.english: Back in the old day, they gave the ill-behaved man a flogging.
sentences.chinese: 过去他们对行为不良的男人，狠狠抽打一顿。

sentences.english: She gave me a dirty look and finally turned around to get my coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她恶狠狠的看我一眼，最后才转过去拿咖啡。

sentences.english: The Mu comes out from Ye in the bedroom, (…) , ruthlessly hold ascend.
sentences.chinese: 姆从卧室里拽出来，狠狠地捧上一顿。

sentences.english: You harshly scold your daughter for knocking the cup over. she breaks down in tears.
sentences.chinese: 你狠狠地臭骂女儿一顿，令她陷于痛苦之中。

sentences.english: Don’t expect to start eating perfectly and exercising religiously tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 不要指望开始狠狠的吃然后明天就虔诚的运动。

sentences.english: Boston punishes teams that don't make quick decisions with the ball.
sentences.chinese: 凯子狠狠的揍了一顿那些不能很快处理球的球队。

sentences.english: I stepped in front of the kid and slapped him hard across the face.
sentences.chinese: 我走上前去，狠狠扇了胖小子一耳光。

sentences.english: These cries of ferocious challenge rang against walls of silence .
sentences.chinese: 那恶狠狠的挑战声在寂静组成的屏壁之内回响。

sentences.english: Suddenly, the squad car is smashed by a van.
sentences.chinese: 忽然，一辆客货两用车狠狠地撞上了警车。

sentences.english: With a malicious crackle the old man held up a small white swaddling garment.
sentences.chinese: 老头啪一声狠狠扯下毯子上的一个白色的小装饰。

sentences.english: Beacause the one that you love. Has pushed you away.
sentences.chinese: 因为你深爱的人把你狠狠拒绝了。

sentences.english: Joe's girl friend really raked him over the coals for forgetting her party.
sentences.chinese: 乔由于忘记出席女朋友的聚会，被她狠狠责备了一顿。

sentences.english: Jastrow knit his brow fiercely at his niece .
sentences.chinese: 杰斯特罗狠狠地对他侄女皱起眉头。

sentences.english: I glared angrily out the window.
sentences.chinese: 我恶狠狠的盯着窗户外面。

sentences.english: The lion's sharp claw hit the wolf's head hard .
sentences.chinese: 狮子锋利的爪子对着老狼的脑袋狠狠地击了一掌。

definition: gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
to beat with the fist/to hammer/to cudgel
a slap on the face/CL:記|记[ji4]
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle
